description: Hyperbolic (cosh) horn validated against Webster horn equation analytical solution
physics: Webster equation for cosh horn: p(x) = [A*exp(-j*k_h*x) + B*exp(j*k_h*x)] / cosh(beta*x) where k_h = sqrt(k^2 - beta^2)

geometry.notes: Chosen to match V2 8:1 radius ratio but with hyperbolic flare â€” isolates profile shape

expected.behavior: High-pass: SPL higher above cutoff than below. Smooth transition at cutoff.
expected.notes: Webster is 1D approximation of 3D. Cutoff fc = beta*c0/(2*pi) where beta = acosh(r_m/r_t)/L.

source: Analytical solution of Webster horn equation for hyperbolic (cosh) profile
